segments.en: “Mendicants, there are four ways of practice.

segments.pli: Dukkhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā, dukkhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā, sukhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā, sukhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā.
segments.en:
1. Painful practice with slow insight,
  2. painful practice with swift insight,
  3. pleasant practice with slow insight, and
  4. pleasant practice with swift insight.

segments.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yāyaṃ paṭipadā dukkhā dandhābhiññā, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭipadā ubhayeneva hīnā akkhāyati. Yampāyaṃ paṭipadā dukkhā, imināpāyaṃ hīnā akkhāyati; yampāyaṃ paṭipadā dandhā, imināpāyaṃ hīnā akkhāyati.
segments.en: Of these, the painful practice with slow insight is said to be inferior in both ways: because it’s painful and because it’s slow.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭipadā ubhayeneva hīnā akkhāyati.
segments.en: This practice is said to be inferior in both ways.

segments.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yāyaṃ paṭipadā dukkhā khippābhiññā, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭipadā dukkhattā hīnā akkhāyati.
segments.en: The painful practice with swift insight is said to be inferior because it’s painful.

segments.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yāyaṃ paṭipadā sukhā dandhābhiññā, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭipadā dandhattā hīnā akkhāyati.
segments.en: The pleasant practice with slow insight is said to be inferior because it’s slow.

segments.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yāyaṃ paṭipadā sukhā khippābhiññā, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭipadā ubhayeneva paṇītā akkhāyati. Yampāyaṃ paṭipadā sukhā, imināpāyaṃ paṇītā akkhāyati; yampāyaṃ paṭipadā khippā, imināpāyaṃ paṇītā akkhāyati.
segments.en: The pleasant practice with swift insight is said to be superior in both ways: because it’s pleasant, and because it’s swift.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭipadā ubhayeneva paṇītā akkhāyati.
segments.en: This practice is said to be superior in both ways.
These are the four ways of practice.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are four ways of practice.

suttaplex.blurb: Painful practice with slow insight, painful practice with swift insight, pleasant practice with slow insight, and pleasant practice with swift insight: which is best?
